cooking_instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, cook until softened.
Add ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, salt, pepper, oregano, and basil. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Serve sauce over cooked spaghetti.
In a wok or large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Add chopped vegetables and tofu to the skillet, stir-fry for 5-7 minutes.
Pour soy sauce over the vegetables and tofu, toss to coat evenly.
Serve over cooked rice.
Season chicken breast with salt and pepper. Grill or bake until cooked through.
Cut cooked chicken into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, toss together chopped romaine lettuce, croutons, and grated Parmesan cheese.
Add cooked chicken to the salad.
Drizzle Caesar dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle olive oil over the salmon fillets and season with minced garlic, chopped dill, salt, and pepper.
Place lemon slices on top of the salmon fillets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges.
Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese into thick slices.
Arrange tomato slices, mozzarella slices, and fresh basil leaves on a serving platter.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.
Cook penne pasta according to package instructions.
Season chicken breast with salt and pepper. Grill or pan-fry until cooked through. Slice into strips.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Pour heavy cream into the skillet and bring to a simmer. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth.
Add cooked pasta and chicken strips to the skillet, toss to coat in the Alfredo sauce.
Serve hot, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese if desired.
Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened.
Stir in minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in vegetable broth and canned tomatoes with their juices. Add chopped potatoes, green beans, bay leaves, and thyme.
Bring soup to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, optionally garnished with fresh parsley.
In a skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in taco seasoning and water according to package instructions. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Warm tortillas in a separate skillet or in the microwave.
Fill tortillas with cooked ground beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomato, grated cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
Serve hot, optionally garnished with chopped cilantro and lime wedges.
Preheat oven to the highest temperature setting (usually around 500°F or 260°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface into a circle.
Spread tomato sauce over the pizza dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
Tear fresh mozzarella cheese into pieces and arrange evenly on top of the sauce.
Place fresh basil leaves on the pizza.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is bubbly.
Serve hot, optionally garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
Cook penne pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add chopped vegetables to the skillet and sauté until tender-crisp.
Toss cooked pasta with the sautéed vegetables. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
Rinse quinoa under cold water. Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chopped cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, finely chopped red onion, and crumbled feta cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss to combine all ingredients.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, minced garlic, minced ginger, and sesame oil.
Marinate chicken thighs in the sauce for at least 30 minutes, or overnight in the refrigerator.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add marinated chicken thighs and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through.
Pour remaining marinade into the skillet and simmer until thickened.
Garnish chicken with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve hot, optionally with steamed rice and vegetables.
In a bowl, beat eggs with salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add chopped bell pepper and onion, cook until softened.
Add chopped spinach and diced tomato to the skillet, cook until spinach is wilted.
Pour beaten eggs over the vegetables. Cook until the edges are set.
Sprinkle grated cheese over one half of the omelette. Fold the other half over the cheese.
Cook for another minute until cheese is melted and omelette is cooked through.
Serve hot, optionally garnished with chopped parsley.
Chop tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, combine chopped vegetables with pitted Kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. Season with dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Toss to combine all ingredients.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
Thinly slice beef sirloin against the grain.
In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, minced garlic, minced ginger, sesame oil, and cornstarch.
Marinate beef slices in the sauce for at least 30 minutes.
In a wok or large skillet, heat oil over high heat. Add marinated beef slices and stir-fry until browned.
Add chopped vegetables to the wok and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Serve hot, optionally over cooked rice.
Cook linguine pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook until pink and opaque.
Pour in white wine and lemon juice. Simmer until slightly reduced.
Toss cooked linguine pasta with the shrimp and sauce.
Garnish with chopped parsley and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, optionally with grated Parmesan cheese.
In a saucepan, heat vegetable broth over low heat.
In a separate large skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, cook until softened.
Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until browned.
Stir in arborio rice and cook for 1 minute, until rice is translucent around the edges.
Pour in white wine and cook until absorbed.
Gradually add warm vegetable broth to the skillet, stirring frequently, until rice is cooked through and creamy.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, optionally garnished with chopped parsley.
Cook penne pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook until softened.
Toss cooked pasta with basil pesto, sautéed cherry tomatoes, and grated Parmesan cheese.
Serve hot, optionally garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and fresh basil leaves.
